Parameters.Name: DeviceUserID
Parameters.Description: User-programmable device identifier.

Parameters.Name: DeviceTemperatureSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects the location within the device, where the temperature will be measured.

Parameters.Name: Width
Parameters.Description: Width of the image provided by the device (in pixels).

Parameters.Name: Height
Parameters.Description: Height of the image provided by the device (in pixels).

Parameters.Name: OffsetX
Parameters.Description: Horizontal offset from the origin to the region of interest (in pixels).

Parameters.Name: OffsetY
Parameters.Description: Vertical offset from the origin to the region of interest (in pixels).

Parameters.Name: BinningHorizontal
Parameters.Description: Number of Horizontal photo-sensitive cells to combine together. This increases the intensity (or signal to noise ratio) of the pixels and reduces the Horizontal resolution (width) of the image.

Parameters.Name: BinningVertical
Parameters.Description: Number of vertical photo-sensitive cells to combine together. This increases the intensity (or signal to noise ratio) of the pixels and reduces the vertical resolution (height) of the image.

Parameters.Name: DecimationHorizontal
Parameters.Description: Horizontal sub-sampling of the image. This reduces the horizontal resolution (width) of the image by the specified horizontal decimation factor.

Parameters.Name: DecimationVertical
Parameters.Description: Vertical sub-sampling of the image. This reduces the vertical resolution (height) of the image by the specified vertical decimation factor.

Parameters.Name: ReverseX
Parameters.Description: Flip horizontally the image sent by the device. The Region of interest is applied after flipping.

Parameters.Name: ReverseY
Parameters.Description: Flip vertically the image sent by the device. The Region of interest is applied after the flipping.

Parameters.Name: PixelFormat
Parameters.Description: Format of the pixel provided by the device. It represents all the information provided by PixelCoding, PixelSize, PixelColorFilter combined in a single feature.

Parameters.Name: TestPattern
Parameters.Description: Selects the type of test pattern that is generated by the device as image source.

Parameters.Name: AcquisitionMode
Parameters.Description: Sets the acquisition mode of the device. It defines mainly the number of frames to capture during an acquisition and the way the acquisition stops.

Parameters.Name: AcquisitionFrameCount
Parameters.Description: Number of frames to acquire in MultiFrame Acquisition mode.

Parameters.Name: TriggerSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects the type of trigger to configure.

Parameters.Name: TriggerMode
Parameters.Description: Controls if the selected trigger is active.

Parameters.Name: TriggerSource
Parameters.Description: Specifies the internal signal or physical input Line to use as the trigger source. The selected trigger must have its TriggerMode set to On.

Parameters.Name: TriggerOverlap
Parameters.Description: Specifies the type trigger overlap permitted with the previous frame. This defines when a valid trigger will be accepted (or latched) for a new frame.

Parameters.Name: TriggerDelay
Parameters.Description: Specifies the delay in microseconds (us) to apply after the trigger reception before activating it.

Parameters.Name: ExposureMode
Parameters.Description: Sets the operation mode of the Exposure (or shutter).

Parameters.Name: ExposureTime
Parameters.Description: Sets the Exposure time (in microseconds) when ExposureMode is Timed and ExposureAuto is Off. This controls the duration where the photosensitive cells are exposed to light.

Parameters.Name: ExposureAuto
Parameters.Description: Sets the automatic exposure mode when ExposureMode is Timed. The exact algorithm used to implement this control is device-specific.

Parameters.Name: AutoExposureTarget
Parameters.Description: When the auto exposure is "once" or "continuous", the the exposure time will be changed, depending on the target value.

Parameters.Name: AutoExposureTimeLowerLimit
Parameters.Description: The minimum exposure time abs of Auto Exposure. Not available in Digital gain mode. (Unit : us)

Parameters.Name: AutoExposureTimeUpperLimit
Parameters.Description: The maximum exposure time abs of Auto Exposure. Not available in digital gain mode.(Unit : us)

Parameters.Name: AutoGainLowerLimit
Parameters.Description: The minimum gain of Auto Gain. (Unit : dB)

Parameters.Name: AutoGainUpperLimit
Parameters.Description: The maximum gain of Auto Gain. (Unit : dB)

Parameters.Name: AcquisitionFrameRateEnable
Parameters.Description: Controls the acquisition rate (in Hertz) at which the frames are captured.

Parameters.Name: AcquisitionFrameRate
Parameters.Description: Controls the acquisition rate (in Hertz) at which the frames are captured.

Parameters.Name: LineSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects the physical line (or pin) of the external device connector to configure.

Parameters.Name: LineDebouncerTime
Parameters.Description: Line Debouncer Time. Unit : us

Parameters.Name: LineInverter
Parameters.Description: Controls the invertion of the signal of the selected input or output Line.

Parameters.Name: CounterSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects which Counter to configure.

Parameters.Name: TimerSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects which Timer to configure.

Parameters.Name: TimerDuration
Parameters.Description: Sets the duration (in microseconds) of the Timer pulse.

Parameters.Name: TimerDelay
Parameters.Description: Sets the duration of the delay to apply at the reception of a trigger before to start the Timer.

Parameters.Name: TimerTriggerSource
Parameters.Description: Selects the source of the trigger to start the Timer.

Parameters.Name: EventSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects which Event to signal to the host application.

Parameters.Name: EventNotification
Parameters.Description: Activate or deactivate the notification to the host application of the occurrence of the selected Event.

Parameters.Name: GainSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects which Gain is controlled by the various Gain features. Do not use both gain at the same time.

Parameters.Name: GainRaw
Parameters.Description: Controls the selected gain as an absolute physical value. This is an amplification factor applied to the video signal.

Parameters.Name: GainAbs
Parameters.Description: Controls ratio of the selected gain.

Parameters.Name: GainAuto
Parameters.Description: Sets the automatic gain control (AGC) mode. The exact algorithm used to implement AGC is device-specific.

Parameters.Name: BlackLevelSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects which Black Level is controlled by the various Black Level features.

Parameters.Name: BlackLevelRaw
Parameters.Description: Controls the analog black level as an absolute physical value. This represents a DC offset applied to the video signal.

Parameters.Name: GammaEnable
Parameters.Description: Activates the Gamma Correction. Gamma correction can not be used simultaneously with the LUT.

Parameters.Name: Gamma
Parameters.Description: Controls the gamma correction of pixel intensity.

Parameters.Name: NoiseReductionEnable
Parameters.Description: Noise Reduction Filter.

Parameters.Name: DefectFilterEnable
Parameters.Description: Enables or Disables the Defect Pixel Filter.

Parameters.Name: DefectFilterTestMode
Parameters.Description: Defect Filter Test Mode Select.

Parameters.Name: DefectPixelReplaceCount
Parameters.Description: Defect Pixel Replace Count.

Parameters.Name: DefectPixelIndex
Parameters.Description: Defect Pixel Index.

Parameters.Name: DefectXCoordinate
Parameters.Description: Defect Pixel X Coordinate.

Parameters.Name: DefectYCoordinate
Parameters.Description: Defect Pixel Y Coordinate.

Parameters.Name: LUTEnable
Parameters.Description: Activates the selected LUT. LUT can not be used simultaneously with the Gamma correction.

Parameters.Name: LUTIndex
Parameters.Description: Control the index (offset) of the coefficient to access in the selected LUT.

Parameters.Name: LowLatencyEnable
Parameters.Description: Minimize image transfer latency for fastest mode. This feature will be applied after camera reboot with storing in userset.

Parameters.Name: GevInterfaceSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects which physical network interface to control.

Parameters.Name: GevSupportedOptionSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects the GEV option to interrogate for existing support.

Parameters.Name: GevCurrentIPConfigurationDHCP
Parameters.Description: Indicates if DHCP IP configuration scheme is activated on the given network interface.

Parameters.Name: GevCurrentIPConfigurationPersistentIP
Parameters.Description: Indicates if PersistentIP configuration scheme is activated on the given network interface.

Parameters.Name: GevHeartbeatTimeout
Parameters.Description: Indicates the current heartbeat timeout in milliseconds.

Parameters.Name: GevGVCPHeartbeatDisable
Parameters.Description: Disables the GVCP heartbeat.

Parameters.Name: GevCCP
Parameters.Description: Controls the device access privilege of an application.

Parameters.Name: GevMCTT
Parameters.Description: Provides the transmission timeout value in milliseconds.

Parameters.Name: GevMCRC
Parameters.Description: Indicates the number of retransmissions allowed when a message channel message times out.

Parameters.Name: GevStreamChannelSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects the stream channel to control.

Parameters.Name: GevSCPInterfaceIndex
Parameters.Description: Index of network interface to use (from 0 to 3).

Parameters.Name: GevSCPSFireTestPacket
Parameters.Description: Sends a test packet. When this feature is set, the device will fire one test packet.

Parameters.Name: GevSCPSDoNotFragment
Parameters.Description: The state of this feature is copied into the "do not fragment" bit of IP header of each stream packet. It can be used by the application to prevent IP fragmentation of packets on the stream channel.

Parameters.Name: GevSCPSPacketSize
Parameters.Description: Specifies the stream packet size in bytes to send on this channel.

Parameters.Name: GevSCPD
Parameters.Description: Indicates the delay (in timestamp counter unit) to insert between each packet for this stream channel. This can be used as a crude flow-control mechanism if the application or the network infrastructure cannot keep up with the packets coming from the device.

Parameters.Name: UserSetSelector
Parameters.Description: Selects the feature User Set to load, save or configure.
